Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery lekanis; slightly thickened rim, flat-topped; white slip; interior reserved; exterior: on edge of rim, band of diagonal strokes; single line at top of wall (fired reddish); below, painted decoration consisting of goat (back, rump, tail and part of hind legs remaining) to right; part of pendant triangle as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The rather shallow profile suggests this is from a dish or a lid.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 243, no. 251, pl. 23, no. 251)
Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 34, no. A. 2a, pl. 1, no. 9)
van de Wiel 1968 / Verzameling ceramiek en Terracotta's Archaeologisch Instituut der Rijksuniversiteit Leiden (p. 2, no. N 4, pl. 1, no. N 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2052) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2903 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
